property.name: dfs.namenode.name.dir
property.description: Determines where on the local filesystem the DFS name node should store the name table(fsimage). If this is a comma-delimited list of directories then the name table is replicated in all of the directories, for redundancy.

property.name: dfs.datanode.data.dir
property.description: Determines where on the local filesystem an DFS data node should store its blocks. If this is a comma-delimited list of directories, then data will be stored in all named directories, typically on different devices.

property.name: dfs.replication
property.description: Default block replication. The actual number of replications can be specified when the file is created.

property.name: dfs.blocksize
property.description: The default block size for new files, in bytes. You can use the following suffixes: k/K for kilobytes, m/M for megabytes, g/G for gigabytes.
